Key Match Events: Brandon Miller's buzzer-beater gave the Charlotte Hornets a 108-107 victory
LaMelo Ball scored five of his 25 points in the final minute
Ronald Holland II’s steal and basket in the final 10 seconds put the Pistons in position to win
Jaden Ivey’s 21 points and Cade Cunningham’s triple-double of 20 points, 10 rebounds and 10 assists led the Pistons
Ball’s 3-point basket propelled the Hornets to a 104-103 lead with 55.2 seconds left
Detroit had gained a little space in the tight game by going up 96-92 on Hardaway’s 3-pointer with 4:02 left
Miscellaneous Highlights: Charlotte had a third-quarter stretch of almost three minutes without scoring, but Williams’ basket and Tidjane Salaun’s 3-pointer provided a 69-64 lead
Others: Detroit lost center Jalen Duren, 20, to an injured left ankle after just eight minutes of playing time
Each team scored 31 points in both the third and fourth quarters
Charlotte outscored the Pistons 9-1 on first-half free throws
